SENT.plain: Myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS) comprises a spectrum of heterogeneous diseases
Most patients present with ineffective hematopoiesis
The pathophysiology involves immune-mediated effects, cytokine dysregulation, and apoptosis, among others

We treated 14 transfusion-requiring patients with MDS, 10 with refractory anemia (RA) and four with RA with excess blasts (RAEB) with a 4-day course of antithymocyte globulin (ATG) followed by intermittent etanercept for 4 months
Among 13 evaluable patients, five are red blood cell and platelet transfusion independent for intervals extending beyond 2 years, and two have normalized their peripheral blood parameters
One additional patient showed a transient rise of platelet and neutrophil counts, for an overall response rate of 46%
Responding patients showed striking improvements in marrow cell abnormalities as characterized by flow cytometry
These data show that a combination of ATG plus etanercept offers effective palliative therapy for unselected patients with MDS
Further trials incorporating these two agents are warranted
